captions.text: You are strong.
You are brave.
You are capable.
You are part of the Lord's most valuable creation.
You have ability.
You have potential.
You have gifts given to you by the Lord.
You have talents to share with the world.
You are a writer, an athlete,

an inventor, an artist, a musician 
a technician,
and these talents will change people.
and these talents will change people

You have joy to spread.
You have jokes to tell, kind words to give,

and wisdom to bestow, and that joy will
change people.

You are full of more amazing qualities,
traits,

and virtues than you could ever imagine,
given to you
by the Lord who loves you, who loves you,
who loves you no matter who you are: whether you're the big man on campus,
or the small guy in the back of the library, whether you like swinging baseball bats,

or you like swing dancing, whether you're the fastest or
the slowest,

the tallest or the shortest, the
skinniest or you could lose a few pounds,

whether you're captain of the
team or last one picked, whether your dad
could beat up his dad

or you never had anyone in your life who
could fill that role,

whether you're the champion of
champions or you feel like the loser

of losers. Regardless of who you may
think you are,
the reality is is that you have a responsibility,
because you have a power inside of you,

a power that was formed before the
beginning of time in a secret place
by the God of the universe. There is a man inside of you,

inside of each and every one of you, that
is waiting
to burst forth and change the world: a man that loves,
encourages, comforts, shares, teaches, laughs, cries, and who builds up
those around him. That man

is where your strength lies. That man is
where your potential lies,

and that man is where your gifts, talent,
courage,

ability, and joy lies, and your
responsibility as a son of God
is to find that man and to set that man free.

And when he is set free, he will bring
change to our broken world.
You will bring change to our broken world.

And any voices in your head that are trying
to tell you differently

are from the enemy, and the next time you
hear them, this is what you say.
You say, "Nuh-uh, not me Satan.

I am a son of the living God, treasured,
entrusted, and loved above all things

by the creator of all things for the
glory of Him who is
greater than all things. I am awesome!"
And don't you forget it. This is who you are.

title: Who You Are: A Message To All Men

comments.text:
To not believe in God, I've noticed many atheists go out of their way to 
talk about Someone who they claim doesn't exist. If they don't believe, why 
do they care so much that someone else does? Sounds more like they may be 
angry at God, not that they believe He doesn't exists. Anger at God can 
still be the beginning of a wonderful relationship with Him. Talk to Him 
and let Him heal you. He can handle your true feelings, even if they're 
dark and angry. Just give them over to Him and let it out. Ask to know Him, 
for who He truly is.﻿

comments.author: Cheree Hayden

comments.text:
The Anima Series videos are breathtaking. The first time I saw the one for 
women, I cried. I have known so many wonderful women throughout my life, 
many of whom never heard these kinds of positive words said about 
themselves. I suppose that might be partly because I am past the 
half-century mark in age, and when I was growing up things were much 
different. With all of the emotion that the video for women stirred in me I 
was eager to find one for men. I was not let down. The first time I watched 
this one I cried also. 
It may surprise some people, but many men, in the secret places inside 
ourselves where we hide these things, do not believe in themselves either.
 I know I don't.
 Viewing this video gives me hope, courage, and the will to soldier on when 
sometimes I would really just like to give up. 
You can be anybody, of any faith, or of no faith, and get something from 
this man's words. What is wrong with saying empowering things about every 
human being? Our society has become increasingly negative, and perhaps 
there is justification for that point of view. However, hearing empowering 
positive things will definitely help us change that negative feeling. 
So, keep spouting your words Jon and I, as well as many others, will keep 
listening.﻿
comments.author: Misfitxy

comments.author: Matthew Brown

comments.text:
These are all great words of advice.  But...I am deeply bothered by the 
fact that there are two separate videos for men and women.  The video for 
men starts by saying they're "Strong" but the first adjective used in the 
womens video is "Beautiful"  I am also strong...and all of the things in 
this video.  I can also change the world.  I don't need a lecture on body 
image, and to be told I'm a "diamond."  These two videos should just be 
combined and called "A message to HUMANS"﻿
comments.author: April Barker

comments.text:
+April Barker oh god, even in a video supposed to be positive and 
uplifting, the feminists still find a reason to complain
comments.author: jammerjammer

comments.text:
Beauty has so little to do with body image. The most physically attractive 
woman in the world loses her lasting appeal if she has no character. Refer 
to Proverbs 31:10-31. Hardly a weak woman described here. I would call her 
motivated, strong, undeterred by challenges, compassionate and loving. Men 
and women are dramatically different. You can change the world. I can 
change the world. But like the different body parts, we all have different 
roles. None less important than another. How is our brain, or organs 
sustained if our hands do not put food into the mouth? I believe it is 
important to acknowledge the differences between men and women. For that 
matter men and men or women and women. We are all different. We all have 
different abilities. I believe the video was meant to encourage people. I 
hope I was able to help a little where these videos failed to encourage 
you.
